pull.title: doc: add alpine build instructions
pull.body:
Closes: #32512

- Provide Alpine build instructions in build-unix.md.
- Instructions cover building all components except USDT which is marked as unsupported for Alpine.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/32559.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -139,6 +139,46 @@ The GUI will be able to encode addresses in QR codes unless this feature is expl
 
 Otherwise, if you don't need QR encoding support, use the `-DWITH_QRENCODE=OFF` option to disable this feature in order to compile the GUI.
 
+### Alpine
+
+#### Dependency Build Instructions
+
+Build requirements:
+
+    apk add build-base cmake libressl libtool linux-headers python3
comments.body: Why `libtool`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -139,6 +139,46 @@ The GUI will be able to encode addresses in QR codes unless this feature is expl
 
 Otherwise, if you don't need QR encoding support, use the `-DWITH_QRENCODE=OFF` option to disable this feature in order to compile the GUI.
 
+### Alpine
+
+#### Dependency Build Instructions
+
+Build requirements:
+
+    apk add build-base cmake libressl libtool linux-headers python3
comments.body: I'd add `pkgconf`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -139,6 +139,46 @@ The GUI will be able to encode addresses in QR codes unless this feature is expl
 
 Otherwise, if you don't need QR encoding support, use the `-DWITH_QRENCODE=OFF` option to disable this feature in order to compile the GUI.
 
+### Alpine

comments.body: `libressl` ?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -139,6 +139,46 @@ The GUI will be able to encode addresses in QR codes unless this feature is expl
 
 Otherwise, if you don't need QR encoding support, use the `-DWITH_QRENCODE=OFF` option to disable this feature in order to compile the GUI.
 
+### Alpine
+
+#### Dependency Build Instructions
+
+Build requirements:
+
+    apk add build-base cmake libressl libtool linux-headers python3
comments.body:
Crikey that's an old hangover....

I ported initial requirements from my current [Alpine Dockerfile](https://github.com/willcl-ark/bitcoin-core-docker/blob/d3676df64a7e5c4b816dc5a6ca542098e5d498f8/master/alpine/Dockerfile#L15)

I foolishly assumed this was just the case of Alpine splitting packages more granularly that e.g. Ubuntu, but taking a closer look now suspect this is a hangover from pre 0.12 where we supported SSL on RPC?

Removed in 5332082d009

@@ -53,6 +53,21 @@ To build dependencies for the current arch+OS:

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -139,6 +139,46 @@ The GUI will be able to encode addresses in QR codes unless this feature is expl
 
 Otherwise, if you don't need QR encoding support, use the `-DWITH_QRENCODE=OFF` option to disable this feature in order to compile the GUI.
 
+### Alpine
+
+#### Dependency Build Instructions
+
+Build requirements:
+
+    apk add build-base cmake linux-headers pkgconf python3
+
+Now, you can either build from self-compiled [depends](#dependencies) or install the required dependencies:
+
+    apk add libevent-dev boost-dev
comments.body: FWIW, `linux-headers` is a dependency of `boost-dev` on my system.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,18 @@ To build dependencies for the current arch+OS:
 
     gmake
 
+### Alpine
+
+    apk add bash build-base cmake curl make patch
+
+Skip the following packages if you don't intend to use the GUI and will build with [`NO_QT=1`](#dependency-options):
+
+    apk add bison linux-headers ninja-build pkgconf python3 xz
+
+To build dependencies for the current arch+OS:
+
+    make
comments.body: not even a nit: `gmake`, which explicitly refers to GNU Make, also works.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -139,6 +139,46 @@ The GUI will be able to encode addresses in QR codes unless this feature is expl
 
 Otherwise, if you don't need QR encoding support, use the `-DWITH_QRENCODE=OFF` option to disable this feature in order to compile the GUI.
 
+### Alpine
+
+#### Dependency Build Instructions
+
+Build requirements:
+
+    apk add build-base cmake linux-headers pkgconf python3
+
+Now, you can either build from self-compiled [depends](#dependencies) or install the required dependencies:
+
+    apk add libevent-dev boost-dev
+
+SQLite is required for the descriptor wallet:
+
+    apk add sqlite-dev
+
+To build Bitcoin Core without wallet, see [*Disable-wallet mode*](#disable-wallet-mode)
+
+ZMQ dependencies (provides ZMQ API):
+
+    apk add zeromq-dev
+
+User-Space, Statically Defined Tracing (USDT) is not directly compatible on
+Alpine as it uses libc functionality not available on musl.
comments.body:
However, depends build the `systemtap` package. The subsequent configuration results in:
```
# cmake -B build --toolchain depends/x86_64-pc-linux-musl/toolchain.cmake
<snip>
  USDT tracing ........................ ON
<snip>
```
And the build succeeds.

cc @0xB10C

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,18 @@ To build dependencies for the current arch+OS:
 
     gmake
 
+### Alpine
+
+    apk add bash build-base cmake curl make patch
+
+Skip the following packages if you don't intend to use the GUI and will build with [`NO_QT=1`](#dependency-options):
+
+    apk add bison linux-headers ninja-build pkgconf python3 xz
comments.body:
1. I think we should consider a note from `apk`:
```
Executing ninja-build-1.12.1-r1.post-install
* this only installs ninja to /usr/lib/ninja-build/bin/ninja
* add that to your path to use it, or invoke it directly.
* for most uses, you want samurai instead:
*  $ apk add samurai
* which has a "ninja" executable compatible with ninja.
```
and install `samurai`. Otherwise, Qt still complains:
```
CMake Warning at qtbase/cmake/QtBuildHelpers.cmake:12 (message):
  The officially supported CMake generator for building Qt is Ninja / Ninja
  Multi-Config.  You are using: 'Unix Makefiles' instead.  Thus, you might
  encounter issues.  Use at your own risk.
```

2. Is `xz` really necessary?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,18 @@ To build dependencies for the current arch+OS:
 
     gmake
 
+### Alpine
+
+    apk add bash build-base cmake curl make patch
+
+Skip the following packages if you don't intend to use the GUI and will build with [`NO_QT=1`](#dependency-options):
+
+    apk add bison linux-headers ninja-build pkgconf python3 xz
comments.body:
> Is xz really necessary?

It's currently pulled in as a cmake dep, but it also seems fine to be explicit.

> and install samurai. 

Yea, I think we should use `samurai` here.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -139,6 +139,46 @@ The GUI will be able to encode addresses in QR codes unless this feature is expl
 
 Otherwise, if you don't need QR encoding support, use the `-DWITH_QRENCODE=OFF` option to disable this feature in order to compile the GUI.
 
+### Alpine
+
+#### Dependency Build Instructions
+
+Build requirements:
+
+    apk add build-base cmake linux-headers pkgconf python3
+
+Now, you can either build from self-compiled [depends](#dependencies) or install the required dependencies:
+
+    apk add libevent-dev boost-dev
+
+SQLite is required for the descriptor wallet:
+
+    apk add sqlite-dev
+
+To build Bitcoin Core without wallet, see [*Disable-wallet mode*](#disable-wallet-mode)
+
+ZMQ dependencies (provides ZMQ API):
+
+    apk add zeromq-dev
+
+User-Space, Statically Defined Tracing (USDT) is not directly compatible on
+Alpine as it uses libc functionality not available on musl.
comments.body: Did using the tracepoints work? Depends and a build will likely succeed, depends is just copying a header, and the CMake existence check is basic.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,18 @@ To build dependencies for the current arch+OS:
 
     gmake
 
+### Alpine
+
+    apk add bash build-base cmake curl make patch
+
+Skip the following packages if you don't intend to use the GUI and will build with [`NO_QT=1`](#dependency-options):
+
+    apk add bison linux-headers ninja-build pkgconf python3 xz
comments.body: Updated to `samurai` and removed explicit `xz` (seems preferable to let this be pulled in as a dependency, or not, by `cmake`) in 4f502baf8f649e30d9495760b54080c272882213

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -139,6 +139,46 @@ The GUI will be able to encode addresses in QR codes unless this feature is expl
 
 Otherwise, if you don't need QR encoding support, use the `-DWITH_QRENCODE=OFF` option to disable this feature in order to compile the GUI.
 
+### Alpine
+
+#### Dependency Build Instructions
+
+Build requirements:
+
+    apk add build-base cmake linux-headers pkgconf python3
+
+Now, you can either build from self-compiled [depends](#dependencies) or install the required dependencies:
+
+    apk add libevent-dev boost-dev
+
+SQLite is required for the descriptor wallet:
+
+    apk add sqlite-dev
+
+To build Bitcoin Core without wallet, see [*Disable-wallet mode*](#disable-wallet-mode)
+
+ZMQ dependencies (provides ZMQ API):
+
+    apk add zeromq-dev
+
+User-Space, Statically Defined Tracing (USDT) is not directly compatible on
+Alpine as it uses libc functionality not available on musl.
comments.body:
I don't have a good way to test this personally, as I'm primarily using alpine in a container. I've therefore updated the comment here to:

```
User-Space, Statically Defined Tracing (USDT) is not supported or tested on Alpine Linux at this time.
```

...which I think is more accurate having done more research into systemtap/dtrace/usdt support on Alpine. This doesn't preclude someone from getting it working/documenting the steps in the future.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -53,6 +53,18 @@ To build dependencies for the current arch+OS:
 
     gmake
 
+### Alpine
+
+    apk add bash build-base cmake curl make patch
+
+Skip the following packages if you don't intend to use the GUI and will build with [`NO_QT=1`](#dependency-options):
+
+    apk add bison linux-headers ninja-build pkgconf python3 xz
comments.body:
> seems preferable to let this be pulled in as a dependency, or not, by cmake

Not sure? It's a dep for Qt, and some of its sub deps. Nothing to do with CMake (just happens to also be pulled in by it).
